page.title: 03Iddesleigh Clubs
page.content: The club or 'Friendly Society' is unique being the oldest of only 2 such clubs in Devon. It is for men only. The club was founded on August 27th 1838 with an annual subscription from members to provide sick pay: 5s a week if a bed case, 3.6s a week for walking sick with a death benefit payment of Â£40. This is still valid today. 51 members pay an annual subscription of 50p. On reaching the age of 70 years they are made life members and are awarded free membership. The club celebrates its anniversay on May Bank Holidy beginning with a roll call and a procession round the village, preceded by a silver band and 2 members carrying a banner. A church service is followed by a dinner in the village hall provided by the local ladies. Members pay Â£1 & the meal is subsidised by the club's investments.
